quotes.quote: Colombia's varied terrain is fertile ground for outdoor adventures to dive, climb, raft, trek, and soar.
O, Columbia the gem of the ocean. The home of the brave and the free. The shrine of each patriot's devotion. A world offers homage to thee.
Fly, swift winged fame, the news proclaim. From shore to shore let cannons roar. and joyful voices shout Columbia's name. Shout Columbia's name.

We live again, Columbia! yea once more / Unto a thousand generations live,/ The mother in the child; to all the West / Through thee shall we earth's choicest blessings give,/ Even as our Orient world in us is blessed.

But I felt as though I still didn't know the Columbia,— where it goes when it's out of sight; who benefits from its power and size; why we think we can pollute the carotid artery of this land; and what we have done to preserve the river's soul after two hundred years of use and abuse.

Colombians have no restrictions on coffee drinking for children— I remember as a young child drinking a cup of cafe con leche (coffee with milk) with eggs and fruit as breakfast before going to school.
Rich and intense, yet soft and mild, perfection is reached in every grain of Colombian coffee.
Corn and cacao beans are staples throughout the basic Colombian diet.
Colombia is a country of celebration and queens. We have festivities for almost every occasion you can think of, both religious and not.
Colombian Spanish is often touted as being the most 'neutral' version of the language in the world.
Although Colombians are very kind and always willing to help, there are a lot of limitations when it comes to communication in a different language.
Colombia's heritage has made it one of the world's most linguistically diverse nations and a variety of ethnicities are represented in the country.
Although Colombia is known for its violence and corruption, it remains one of the most beautiful places in the world and possesses a beauty that is not subject to the will or violence of man.

Colombia is so different to what I know, and every aspect of the country is different to England, and I loved it. I loved the culture and the food, and the coffee was amazing. The place that we were was stunning, and it really was quite an amazing experience to film out there.
Colombia is not how people think it is. We used to eat fish every Sunday at the beach. In the town where I grew up, people did not tell lies.
Well, in Colombia everybody's very voluptuous, and you're supposed to be. You don't want to be skinny when all of your cousins are mermaids. You grow up thinking that's how beauty is.
Anybody who lives in Colombia knows that if you don't have any money - I tell you what - you don't have many options.

In Colombia, where I was born and raised, women like my mother considered their appearance and personal grooming a matter of principle. There was never an occasion where she didn't show up looking picture-perfect.

For decades, Colombia has been accused of being the world's principal provider of cocaine. If this comes to an end, it would be a dramatic change for our country - which has been suffering more than any other from the consequences of drug-trafficking.
No one can feel as the owner of the country and no one can feel excluded from the right of property. We must all suffer Colombia.
Colombia is in a risky position. They've got a peace process that's going nowhere, and a drug production problem that's skyrocketing.
In Colombia, education is sometimes considered a luxury, not a human right. And it's not a priority in the agendas of many leaders.
The Colombian economy is very strong. We have one of the highest rates of growth in Latin America.
Colombian humor is very black, very sarcastic.
In Colombia, we have a lot of passion.
The Colombians are good-tempered people. They are used to waiting for buses that are late, used to riding buses and trains that do not arrive.
